name: Semaglutide
overview: Semaglutide is a GLP-1 receptor agonist approved by regulatory agencies for type 2 diabetes management and chronic weight management. It works by mimicking incretin hormones that regulate blood sugar and appetite.
what_people_seek: Blood sugar regulation (in context of diabetes care)
who_should_avoid: Those with a personal or family history of medullary thyroid carcinoma
People with Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia syndrome type 2 (MEN 2)
Individuals with a history of severe gastrointestinal disease
Anyone with a known hypersensitivity to semaglutide
interactions_notes: May interact with insulin, sulfonylureas, and other diabetes medications, increasing risk of hypoglycemia. May delay gastric emptying, affecting absorption of oral medications. Discuss all medications with your healthcare provider.
dosing_ranges_literature: For weight management, typical escalation starts at 0.25 mg weekly, gradually increasing to a maintenance dose of 2.4 mg weekly as tolerated. For diabetes, dosing protocols differ. Always follow prescriber guidance.
storage_notes: Unopened pens and vials should be refrigerated. After first use, some formulations may be kept at room temperature for a limited period. Follow manufacturer instructions closely.
